laboratory_examinations.findings: Two 4-mm biopsy specimens showed concentric perifollicular fibrosis at the level of the follicular infundibulum with a moderately dense inflammatory cell infiltrate composed of lymphocytes, plasma cells, and neutrophils. Dilation of the follicular infundibulum with follicular plugging was noted. Periodic acid-Schiff staining was negative for fungi or basement-membrane thickening.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A scalp biopsy specimen obtained several years earlier from the patientâ€™s father was reported to show acute and chronic folliculitis with fibrosis, indicating changes over time.

laboratory_examinations.findings: A 4-mm biopsy performed on the patient's sister demonstrated a normal follicle count of 32, perifollicular fibrosis, and chronic inflammation of the upper portion of hair follicles without significant neutrophilic infiltrate or follicular plugging.
